revised_title: Improving Deep-Sea Temperature Measurements with Self-Registering Thermometers
tldr: The author describes a new method for protecting self-registering thermometers from pressure effects during deep-sea temperature measurements. By enclosing the thermometer bulb in a second glass tube filled with alcohol, the instrument can accurately measure temperature changes without being affected by pressure. This innovation improves deep-sea temperature data accuracy and contributes to better understanding of oceanic conditions.
